prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Group1
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: CO(1-0) in a group of isolated galaxies

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Field & Spatial Resolution: We want to map the CO(1-0) emission in the sample with an uniform surface density rms (40 Msun/pc2) to cover the main disk with a single pointing (> R25/2) To detect the finest details of the CO(1-0) emission in the disk and to get the requested surface density rms we set a spatial resolution of 1" optimizing the spatial resolution and the sensitivity. We have gathered the maximum of targets within 10 degrees to minimize the calibration time.
Spectral Setup: We need to get a velocity resolution of 20 km/s We setup 4 basebands of 1.8 GHz bandwidth.
Sensitivity: We expect to have at least a peak intensity of ~ 50 mJy/beam for the CO(1-0) in the targest according to our IRAM-30m detections. We note that our rms is about 15 times better than our IRAM-30m observations to detect the weak emission and the previously non-detected galaxies (10 galaxies). To have a SNR>3 in the outer part of the galaxies, we request a rms of 2 mJy for the mapping of these galaxies.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Despite the widespread idea that secular evolution is sufficient to form pseudobulges with similar blue colors/SF to their disks, AMIGA sample of very isolated galaxies is dominated by disks hosting bulges of small Sersic indices, consistent with pseudobulges, but as red as Es. Their molecular gas is less abundant or more extended than in denser environments, and CCH overabundance relative to HCN and HCO+, favour it to be more extended. These supports different molecular gas properties in isolated galaxies relative to denser environments, where gravitational torques/accretion from companions might play a dominant role in increasing SFE when compared to bars or gas accretion from the cosmic web. We propose to investigate differences in molecular gas distribution/kinematics between: disk/pseudobulges, barred/non barred galaxies, and samples in other environments. We have selected a sample of (N = 18) AMIGA galaxies to be mapped with ALMA(CO(1-0) line, 1" resol), the only radiointerferometer able to both map the disk of a significant sample of the isolated galaxies and resolve their small pseudobulges in < 6h.

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: IRAM Grenoble, Institute of Millimetric Radioastronomy (IRAM)
Facultad de Ciencias Fisicas, Universidad Complutense de Madrid
Department of Astronomy, Massachusetts at Amherst, University of
